form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Hawley (for himself and Mr. Welch) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To require that the retail list price for certain prescription drugs and biological products may not exceed the average retail list price for the drug or biological product among certain nations.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fair Prescription Drug Prices for Americans Act.

section.header: International reference pricing for prescription drugs and biological products

paragraph.text: The term biological product means a biological product licensed under subsection (a) or (k) of section 351 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 262).
The term drug means a drug approved under subsection (c) or (j) of section 505 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 355).
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Health and Human Services.

subsection.header: Cap on retail list price of prescription drugs and biological products
subsection.text: The retail list price in the United States for a drug or a biological product may not exceed the average retail list price for the drug or biological product among Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, and the United Kingdom, as calculated under subsection (c).

subsection.header: Calculation of average retail list price
subsection.text: The Secretary shall calculate on an annual basis the average retail list price for each drug and biological product sold in Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, and the United Kingdom, through a combination of data reported by manufacturers of drugs and biological products under subsection (e) and data obtained through review of publicly filed materials by manufacturers of drugs and biological products in such countries.

paragraph.text: Any manufacturer that violates subsection (b) with respect to a drug or biological product shall be subject to a civil monetary penalty imposed by the Secretary in amount equal to the product obtained by multiplying—

clause.text: the list price for the drug or biological product sold in the United States; and
the average retail list price for the drug or biological product sold in Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, and the United Kingdom, as calculated under subsection (c); and

paragraph.text: The amount of a civil monetary penalty under paragraph (1) shall be calculated and charged for each unit of drug or biological product sold.

subsection.text: Each manufacturer of a drug or biological product shall submit to the Secretary on an annual basis—

paragraph.text: the list price for the drug or biological product sold in the United States; and
the list price for the drug or biological product sold in each of Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, and the United Kingdom.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall issue guidance and promulgate regulations to implement this section.
